fields.name: location_why
fields.content: At the end of this survey you will be able to hide your contact information and location information or voluntarily choose to make it public for the VSP report.

fields.name: drag_map_info
fields.content: Please drag and zoom the map to center the pin on your property.

fields.name: address
fields.prompt: Or, search by address:
fields.placeholder: Your address will never be shared

fields.name: analysis_unit
fields.prompt: Of the three watersheds on the map, in which does your land primarily lie?

fields.name: acres_owned_leased
fields.prompt: How many acres of land do you own/lease and actively farm or ranch on? (Choose one)

fields.name: current_crops
fields.prompt: What crops are you currently growing, or have you previously (between 2011—now) grown on your land? Choose all that apply.

fields.name: other_crops
fields.prompt: Other (please explain)

fields.name: wetlands_header
fields.content:
4. Wetland Areas

Description

Wetland areas are inundated or saturated by surface water or groundwater.

Appearance on map

fields.name: private-property_on_wetlands
fields.prompt: Does your property lie on any wetlands?

fields.name: frequently_flooded_header
fields.content:
5. Frequently Flooded Areas

Description

Frequently flooded areas are subject to a 1% or greater chance of flooding every year.

Appearance on map

fields.name: private-property_on_frequently_flooded
fields.prompt: Does your property lie on any frequently flooded areas?

fields.name: geologic_hazard_header
fields.content:
6. Severe Geologic Hazard Areas

Description

Severe geologic hazard areas are susceptible to erosion, sliding, earthquakes, and other events.

Appearance on map

fields.name: private-property_on_geologic_hazard
fields.prompt: Does your property lie on any severe geologic hazard areas?

fields.name: critical_aquifer_header
fields.content:
7. Critical Aquifer Recharge Areas

Description

Critical aquifer recharge areas have a critical effect on aquifers used for potable water.

Appearance on map

fields.name: private-property_on_critical_aquifer
fields.prompt: Does your property lie on any critical aquifer recharge areas?

fields.name: critical_conservation_header
fields.content:
8. Critical Conservation Areas

Description

Critical conservation areas are managed to maintain habitats of fish and wildlife.

Appearance on map

fields.name: private-property_on_criticak_conservation
fields.prompt: Does your property lie on any critical conservation areas?

fields.name: tillage_header
fields.content:
9. Crop Practices

Please fill out the form below to report your crop practices. If you do not farm your land, please proceed to the next section.

fields.name: conservation_cover
fields.prompt: Do you participate in any conservation cover practices (establishing and maintaining long-term, permanent vegetative cover)?
fields.label: Conservation cover

content.label: No, but interested in learning more

fields.name: conservation_cover_date
fields.prompt: When did you first implement conservation cover practices?

fields.name: conservation_cover_amount
fields.prompt: On how many acres of cropland have you implemeted conservation cover practices (estimate used for reporting purposes only)?

fields.name: cropland_pest_management
fields.prompt: Do you participate in integrated pest management practices (a site-specific combination of pest prevention, pest avoidance, pest monitoring, and pest suppression strategies) on cropland?
fields.label: Integrated pest management on cropland

content.label: No, but interested in learning more

fields.name: cropland_pest_management_date
fields.prompt: When did you first implement integrated pest management practices on cropland?

fields.name: cropland_pest_management_amount
fields.prompt: On how many acres of cropland have you implemented pest management practices (estimate used for reporting purposes only)?

fields.name: cover_crop
fields.prompt: Do you participate in any cover crop practices (using grasses, legumes, and leafy ground cover plants for seasonal vegetative cover)?
fields.label: Cover crop

content.label: No, but interested in learning more

fields.name: cover_crop_date
fields.prompt: When did you first implement cover crop practices?

fields.name: cover_crop_amount
fields.prompt: On how many acres of cropland have you implemented cover crop practices (estimate used for reporting purposes only)?

fields.name: crop_riparian_forest_buffer
fields.prompt: Do you participate in having a riparian forest buffer (an area predominantly of suitable trees and/or shrubs planted along a stream, river, lake, or other water body) on cropland?
fields.label: Riparian forest buffer on cropland

content.label: No, but interested in learning more

fields.name: crop_riparian_forest_buffer_date
fields.prompt: When did you first implement riparian forest buffer practices on cropland?

fields.name: crop_riparian_forest_buffer_amount
fields.prompt: How many feet of cropland riparian forest buffer have you implemented (estimate used for reporting purposes only)?

fields.name: residue_tillage_management
fields.prompt: Do you participate in residue and tillage management/reduced till (managing the amount, orientation, and distribution of crop and other plant residue on the soil surface year-round)?
fields.label: Residue and tillage management

content.label: No, but interested in learning more

fields.name: residue_tillage_management_date
fields.prompt: When did you first implement residue and tillage management practices?

fields.name: residue_tillage_management_amount
fields.prompt: On how many acres of cropland have you implemented residue and tillage management practices (estimate used for reporting purposes only)?

fields.name: nutrient_management
fields.prompt: Do you participate in nutrient management (managing the amount, source, placement, and timing of plant nutrients and soil amendments)?
fields.label: Residue and tillage management

content.label: No, but interested in learning more

fields.name: nutrient_management_date
fields.prompt: When did you first implement nutrient management practices?

fields.name: nutrient_management_amount
fields.prompt: On how many acres of cropland have you implemented nutrient management practices (estimate used for reporting purposes only)?

fields.name: crop_fencing
fields.prompt: Do you participate in fencing (a constructed barrier to protect animals or people) on cropland?
fields.label: Fencing on cropland

content.label: No, but interested in learning more

fields.name: crop_fencing_date
fields.prompt: When did you first implement fencing on cropland?

fields.name: crop_fencing_amount
fields.prompt: How many feet of cropland fencing have you implemented (estimate used for reporting purposes only)?

fields.name: livestock_header
fields.content:
10. Livestock Practices

Please fill out the form below to report your livestock practices. If you do not ranch your land, please proceed to the next section.

fields.name: ranch_riparian_forest_buffer
fields.prompt: Do you participate in having a riparian forest buffer (an area predominantly of suitable trees and/or shrubs planted along a stream, river, lake, or other water body) on ranchland?
fields.label: Riparian forest buffer on ranchland

content.label: No, but interested in learning more

fields.name: ranch_riparian_forest_buffer_date
fields.prompt: When did you first implement riparian forest buffer practices on ranchland?

fields.name: ranch_riparian_forest_buffer_amount
fields.prompt: How many feet of ranchland riparian forest buffer have you implemented (estimate used for reporting purposes only)?

fields.name: ranch_fencing
fields.prompt: Do you participate in fencing (a constructed barrier to protect animals or people) on ranchland?
fields.label: Fencing on ranchland

content.label: No, but interested in learning more

fields.name: ranch_fencing_date
fields.prompt: When did you first implement fencing on ranchland?

fields.name: ranch_fencing_amount
fields.prompt: How many feet of ranchland fencing have you implemented (estimate used for reporting purposes only)?

fields.name: stream_habitat_improvement
fields.prompt: Do you participate in stream habitat improvement and management (maintaining, improving, or restoring physical, chemical and biological functions of a stream and its associated riparian zone)?
fields.label: Stream habitat improvement and management

content.label: No, but interested in learning more

fields.name: stream_habitat_improvement_date
fields.prompt: When did you first implement stream habitat improvement?

fields.name: stream_habitat_improvement_amount
fields.prompt: How many feet of ranchland stream habitat improvement have you implemented (estimate used for reporting purposes only)?

fields.name: livestock_grazing
fields.prompt: Do you participate in livestock grazing (managing the harvest of vegetation with grazing and/or browsing animals and soil amendments)?
fields.label: Livestock grazing

content.label: No, but interested in learning more

fields.name: livestock_grazing_date
fields.prompt: When did you first participate in livestock grazing?

fields.name: livestock_grazing_amount
fields.prompt: On how many acres of ranchland have you implemented livestock grazing practices (estimate used for reporting purposes only)?

fields.name: watering_facility
fields.prompt: Do you participate in having a watering facility? (a means of providing a controlled water source to livestock or wildlife)?
fields.label: Watering facility

content.label: No, but interested in learning more

fields.name: watering_facility_date
fields.prompt: When did you first participate in having a watering facility?

fields.name: watering_facility_amount
fields.prompt: How many water facilities have you implemented (estimate used for reporting purposes only)?

fields.name: other
fields.content:
11. Other Conservation Practices

Are there any additional Conservation Practices you participate in that weren’t listed within the survey? Please list them here, with the year implemented, in the space provided.

fields.name: other_practices_description
fields.prompt: Please describe your other Conservation Practices:

fields.name: additional_info_header
fields.content:
12. Almost completed!

Thank you for taking the time to voluntarily report your stewardship practices.

fields.name: funding_sources
fields.prompt: For the conservation practices you currently participate in, what are your funding sources?

fields.name: desired_outcome
fields.prompt: Through this survey, what would you like to gain? Are you interested in learning about funding options, available technical assistance, or other Conservation Practices available to you? Please be as detailed as possible.

fields.name: my_image
fields.prompt: Show your conservation practices! Upload photos before, during, or after you implemented your stewardship practices:
fields.label: Upload photos

fields.name: private-landowner_name
fields.placeholder: Your name will only be shared if you are logged in
fields.prompt: What is your name?

fields.name: private-use_photos
fields.prompt: Can Columbia County VSP highlight your photos on our website?

fields.name: private-landowner_email
fields.placeholder: Your email address will never be made public
fields.prompt: What is your email address? (Your email address will be used for reporting purposes only, and will never be made public.)

fields.name: private-landowner_phone
fields.prompt: What is your phone number? (Your phone number will be used for reporting purposes only, and will never be made public.)
fields.placeholder: Your phone number will never be made public

fields.name: private
fields.prompt: Would you be willing to share your stewardship story with the public? Checking "yes" below will place a pin on the map upon submission and your stewardship actions will be visible to the public.

content: Your Columbia County VSP Coordinators are interested in helping meet your stewardship goals.
Contact a local VSP Coordinator for more information:

Welcome Columbia County Voluntary Stewards!

Get Started
The Columbia County Voluntary Stewardship Program (VSP) is an innovative approach to reporting the protection of critical areas.
